anti_patterns.name: Ignoring official samples
anti_patterns.problem: Reinventing patterns that already exist in SAP samples leads to inconsistent implementations and missed best practices
anti_patterns.fix: Always search SAP-samples repositories first, adapt existing patterns rather than building from scratch

anti_patterns.name: Not using version control
anti_patterns.problem: Custom ABAP development without version control makes collaboration difficult and loses change history
anti_patterns.fix: Use abapGit for all custom development, commit frequently with meaningful messages

anti_patterns.name: Skipping code quality checks
anti_patterns.problem: Deploying code without quality checks introduces technical debt and compliance issues
anti_patterns.fix: Integrate abaplint and abapOpenChecks into CI/CD pipeline, fix issues before deployment

anti_patterns.name: Copying code without understanding
anti_patterns.problem: Copying code from samples without understanding the pattern leads to incorrect implementations
anti_patterns.fix: Study the reference code, understand the pattern, then adapt it to your specific use case

anti_patterns.name: Not checking community solutions
anti_patterns.problem: Missing proven solutions from SAP Community leads to suboptimal implementations
anti_patterns.fix: Search SAP Community before implementing custom solutions, leverage community knowledge
